intro: Warrea hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's warrea, is a flowering plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
